website_summaries.verdict: This grill includes a smoker and will exceed your expectations, delivering on all fronts, heat, ease of use, and size.
pros: Includes a smoker box and a rotisserie
Cooks just as well using two burners as all six
cons: Pricier than other grills on the market, but does not require an outside kitchen

website_summaries.verdict: If money is no object and you want a grill that will do everything you could possible expect from it, this is your top choice.
pros: Massive, six-burner grill w/side burner, rotisserie, smoker burner, lights – anything you could want in a grill
Comes in both natural gas and liquid propane versions
cons: For small gatherings, it may be more than needed

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful well made grill
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Slept on the couch for about a week once my wife figured out how much I paid for this barbecue grill. Now that I have it, I use it 3 to 4 times a week, which means she does not have to cook, therefore I win. I love this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Nick G

customer_reviews.title: I like my Webber Summit BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with the grill. But I do have a nagging continuing problem. The electronic tank gas volume scale (located on the control panel) does not work correctly. So far I have found customer service helpful and prompt but even a replacement part, it still does not work. When I depress the "button" on the control panel the top, middle and bottom lights illuminate simultaneously. Considering the cost of this model, I am now hoping they can send a repair person to take a look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Better and Worse than Prior Version of Same Model
customer_reviews.text: Materials are cheaper than our previous BBQ (same model). Love that they’ve incorporated storage for the rotisserie !!
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful grill!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is amazing! High quality materials, assembly is a snap, what little assembly is even required. The smoker box with dedicated burner is my favorite part! It's pricy, no doubt, but it's made well, it's huge, lots of cooking space and options. Should last for many, many years with a little care.
customer_reviews.author: 2Liter

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: I have been impressed with the overall cooking ability of this grill. The space is huge, the burners generate tremendous heat for all levels of cooking and it is solid construction. My only complaint so far is that one of the firing mechanisms in one of the lighting handles has stopped working. Not cool for such an expensive grill, after only a few months. That one burner lights fine, manually, but...
customer_reviews.author: T. Birnley

customer_reviews.title: Best grill ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grillI have ever owned (and there were many). It is extremely well built, and the quality of construction is very apparent. It lights instantly and without any hassel. The packing was excellent, but quite a project to get it undone. You need three people to get the grill off its pallet. after that its a breeze to put it together. Ilike the idea that you can repair and replace the burners very easily when needed.
customer_reviews.author: S Brustowicz

customer_reviews.title: I love this grill
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. I'd gladly give it a five star rating, except that the rotisserie motor died after less than two months of use. It was only used three times and was protected by a covering from all the elements. Aside from this, it's an amazing grill.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Wegner

customer_reviews.title: We have been very happy with our new grill
customer_reviews.text: We have been very happy with our new grill. It is so easy to use. There was a slight problem with a dent in the back panel when it was opened. Weber customer service were very helpful and sent a replacement right away. Great service.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Hurwitz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and has everything in a gas grill
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with this grill. Have owned several Weber charcoal grills but wanted to try gas for the convenience and versatility. The grill arrived damaged on the side. Nothing that affected the performance. Merchant did not want to replace with another unit but suggested repairing it. We weren't too happy about this but accepted the suggestion. It did take 6 weeks to have the panel replaced but the installer was very professional and did a thorough job of getting the new panel on. I am not giving the grill 5 stars simply because of the issue with the damage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Champagne

customer_reviews.title: great del. and great product
customer_reviews.text: the only thing bad with this product is it is a fair trade pricing item-----it was a very good delivery great company and driver ---thats what makes amazon great
customer_reviews.author: John Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Best grill to date
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was the best I have experienced (thank you JB Hunt!); arrived in mint condition. NOTE: you do need THREE PEOPLE to get it out of the crate. Assembly very easy. Up and running in no time. Cooks wonderfully. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality of construction and material
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality of construction and material. Very easy assembly of a few parts and you are ready to cook, so long as you have a natural gas line. Really have only had a chance to use it a few times so far, but very rapid to heat up, excellent temperature control, and well built enough that you need to be careful. It remains relatively cool to the touch while it quickly gets to 600+ F so it pays to monitor using the accurate built in thermometer. Expensive, but in terms of value, still a great buy. Yep, it's an absolute toy, but an enjoyable one.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great looking
customer_reviews.text: Best grill I have ever used. heat control is great!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: The Best and Hottest Natural Gas Grill.
customer_reviews.text: My new grill is impressive. First, the delivery was the best. I explained in advance to Amazon that my delivery might be an issue. The packaged grill weighs over 300 pounds. I needed it carried up 10 steps, around to the back of my house, and then down three steps to my patio. Amazon's response..."no problem". Now that's service. The natural gas grill assembly was simple and took 2 hours at a slow pace. She fired up the first time I connected the gas lines. This gas grill really gets hot. My steaks will now be cooked just like in the expensive restaurants. I'm quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN G. KIDD

customer_reviews.title: ... say this is the king of grills we just love
customer_reviews.text: What can I say this is the king of grills we just love it
customer_reviews.author: rewreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic grill. I've used it many times. My neighbor is ordering one now.
customer_reviews.author: Becky M Montesino

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, need to experiment with the grilling temperatures a few times before grilling for a dinner party or picnic.
customer_reviews.author: LMHRVA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so far so good assembly was easy everything worked as advertised
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES AINSWORTH

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd Weber Summit. I had a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Weber Summit. I had a 470 natural gas, but we moved to a location that is propane. I did not even look at other grills. I knew that I had to have another summit, but this time I did go bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Puckett

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line but neeeds regular cleaning
customer_reviews.text: We bought this grill last year, and delivery was great. The grill has all the bells and whistles and seems to go through gas more slowly than the old non-Weber model. One complaint, which may not be the grill's fault: It is tough to thoroughly clean. We grill a lot of meat and the grease piles up and tends to bake on. Yes, we could grill vegetables--but then why buy a grill?
customer_reviews.author: Joe1234

customer_reviews.title: Weber Summit S-670 Grill
customer_reviews.text: The grill came on the back of a semi. No problems getting it ot the garage, put it together there (not much, grates, flavor bars etc.) and rolled it to the back yard. The grill looks and even better works GREAT! Weber is the only way to go when looking at grills. I took my 10 year old A-Series grill, replaced the burners, grates and flavor bars and I am giving it to my daughter. It is like new after 10 years of great use!
customer_reviews.author: John_hockey

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very heavy, you need 2 people to lift the grill out of box.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Feng

customer_reviews.title: my wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes to cook on the grill---even in the winter. She loves this grill. It was packed well an mostly assembled when it came, including the casters already installed. It was so heavy we had our son-in-law and one of his friends take it from the garage up two stairs to the outdoor deck.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Senn

customer_reviews.title: Weber Summit S670 Natural Gas Grill
customer_reviews.text: We researched grills for a good while before deciding to go with the Weber Summit S670. We are very pleased with the grill and all the awesome features. Really happy that we switched to a Natural Gas Grill.
customer_reviews.author: juju

customer_reviews.title: An extremely expensive grill but it really works wonderful – great taste and easy-to-use – if you can ...
customer_reviews.text: An extremely expensive grill but it really works wonderful – great taste and easy-to-use – if you can afford it. I strongly recommend buying it. And after buying thousands of dollars worth of stuff from Amazon the company gets five stars in my book
customer_reviews.author: JACK L BENTLEY JR.

customer_reviews.title: Super Grill
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of ordering starts and stops, I received my new grill. It was delivered on a pallet and seemingly well protected. It only took an hour to complete assembly as it is 90% assembled...much easier than I was lead to believe. It had a dented door, I immediately called Weber and a new door was on the way, as well they registered my grill...that was amazing response, there was no questions asked and about 3 days later i had a new door. The grill works great, from the initial lighting. I expect to have it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fangman

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this grill!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. Bought it to replace 13 year old genesis silver. The cook area is spacious, allowing for many items to be cooked at once. 6 main burners let's you dial in each cook zone for different foods. Rotisserie is so easy to use, as is the smoker box. Temperature control is precise. Wasn't sure I'd like the smoker taking up grill space, but it's perfect and I'll use it much more than I would an aftermarket smoker box that has to go under the grate. Only regret is that I didn't buy this grill sooner.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great bbq. Still practicing with it. The smoker box could be better, chips burn quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Service, delivery and tracking were brilliant. The BBQ while i haven't used it yet as it arrived yesterday and today it rains is as impressive in the flesh as it was online. Very functional and does what it says on the box. if you like to bbq then you must weber
customer_reviews.author: Martin Shanahan

customer_reviews.title: Best grill ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Powerful heat Sear station Smoker box Bells and whistles (lights) Easy to clean Dislikes: Gas tank display is inaccurate as tank rubs against the side of the grill housing causing inaccurate reading, Tank should float within grill cavity. I would highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: The quality is not reflective of the high price.
customer_reviews.text: I received this $2500 BBQ with a broken PLASTIC wheel -- yes, for $2500, weber thinks wheels should be made of plastic. After having my new bbq balancing on a couple of bricks for THREE weeks, i finally received the new wheel. Great. Since, I've used the grill a couple of times and it grills OK. Today, four weeks after owning the grill, I go to try the rotisserie only to realize that the made in taiwan motor does not work -- is this a joke?
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Grill
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a replacement grill for some time. Most of the ones I found looked nice but there quality is quite low. Saw a lower model in Home Depot, and really liked it. This is what I had been looking for it is pricey, but in my search I found in grills you get what you pay for. This is worth the money, and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: David O Bonadurer

customer_reviews.title: S-670 BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I look long and hard before settling on this BBQ, comparing high end bbq with this one. The features and value you get from this BBQ is superb. Installation was very straight forward and legible and intelligible instructions. I love the searing feature. The meat comes out fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: busydad

customer_reviews.title: Not off to a good start. Hopefully I can update this review with ...
customer_reviews.text: Will update on the actual performance of the grill once built. 1. Product came dented or was built incorrectly. See photo. 2. The delivery guys put the product where I asked them to but didn't remove the Box and most importantly did not remove the product from the intricate locking plastic pallet. So now I need to find two other massive people that are capable of lifting that several hundred pound grill out of this pallet so I can complete the process of building it. Not off to a good start. Hopefully I can update this review with improvements soon
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing the rotisserie rod. For this price, someone should check off on every box before shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Weber 7470001 Summit S-670 6-Burner Natural Gas Grill, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description:
Style:Natural GasWeber Summit S-670, stainless steel, Natural gas grill with tuck-away rotisserie motor, features a stainless steel enclosed cart with chrome plated cast aluminum handles, 60,000 BTU main burner & 6 stainless steel burners, 12,000 BTU flush mounted side burner, 10,600 BTU infrared rear mounted rotisserie burner, 10,600 sear burner, 8,000 BTU smoker burner & smoker box, snap-jet ignition system, grills are accent colored painted steel frame, stainless shroud with polished handle & trim, accent-colored cast-aluminum end caps, 2 stainless steel work surfaces, accent-colored painted steel frame, lighted control knobs, 6 tool hooks, 2 handle lights, enclosed tank storage area, includes Weber cookbook, limited warranty,and 10-feet flexible hose. Item comes with 6 Stainless Steel burners and a side burner.

AMAZON.COM


9 mm diameter stainless-steel rod cooking grates retain heat evenly and create delicious sear marks. (Model E-420 shown) view larger 10,600 BTU-per-hour sear burner steps up the heat on demand for searing. (Model E-470 shown) view larger LED tank scale--check the fuel status with a push of the button. (LP models only) view larger Grill Out handle lights illuminate the grill--integrated tilt sensor with auto-on when raising the lid. (Model E-670 shown) 
view larger Create general indirect heat for a slow cook and exceptionally flavorful results. (Model E-670 shown) view larger 12,000 BTU-per-hour input flush-mount side burner lets you multi-task while grilling. (Model S-420 shown) view larger Spread out the heat when cooking for a crowd. (Model E-670 shown) view larger Stainless-steel work area with tool hooks for easy access. (Model E-420 shown) view larger Keep the heat in one section for fast, direct heat--perfect when cooking for one or two people. (Model E-670 shown) 
view larger WEBER SUMMIT S SERIES GAS GRILLS
WELCOME TO TOP OF THE LINE
These outstanding grills are the crown jewels of the Weber family. From exclusive features to the highest level of performance, these babies will make even seasoned grillers blush.

WEBER'S ORIGINAL GAS GRILLING SYSTEM
Notice how sturdy the shroud feels as it opens smoothly on its hinges? See how the burners roar to life on the very first try? Delighted by how simple it is to achieve a mouthwatering meal every time? It's no accident. Weber spends countless hours perfecting the grilling systems on its gas grills, assuring easy assembly, an evenly heated cooking surface, and precision controls so you can tone things down or up to the perfect heat level for direct or indirect cooking.

COOKBOX AND SHROUD
The cookbox houses the components of the cooking system: cooking grates, burner tubes, Favorizer Bars, and the grease management system.

Made of cast aluminum, Weber's gas-grill cookboxes are durable, efficient, require minimal care and maintenance, and can withstand the heat needed to grill at any temperature. In addition, the shape of the cookbox, when combined with the shroud, allows for the proper circulation of heat around food for even cooking whether you're using direct or indirect heat.

COOKING GRATES
Weber gas-grill cooking grates come in three exceptional materials: porcelain-enameled steel, stainless steel, and porcelain-enameled cast-iron. Each type retains heat evenly and sears food beautifully. Porcelain-enameled steel cooking grates are durable and easy to clean. Stainless steel rod cooking grates make lovely sear marks, hold heat very well, and clean up with ease. Porcelain-enameled cast-iron cooking grates combine the ease of porcelain-enameled with the superior heat retention of cast-iron--no need to season and easy to clean.

BURNER TUBES
Weber's burners are made of high-grade stainless steel, which will stand up to the small amounts of water found in liquid propane and natural gas. The burner tubes are made of a singular piece of steel with no welds, making them stronger and more resistant to rust and burn-through. And while they are protected from grease drippings and food by the Flavorizer bars, Weber cart gas grill burner tubes can be cleaned easily by gently brushing with a Weber stainless-steel grill brush.

Controls for each burner give you the ability to grill by the direct or indirect method. Even more, the burners are spaced to provide heat across the entire cooking grate, and the burner valves have infinite control settings, so you can fine-tune the heat levels. 

FLAVORIZER BARS
The innovative Flavorizer bar system, originally created by Weber, is designed perfectly to perform a variety of functions on the Spirit , Summit, and Summit gas grills. Angled just right, the Flavorizer bars catch drippings that smoke and sizzle, adding flavor to your food. Any drippings not vaporized by the Flavorizer bars follow the slope of their unique angle and are funneled away from the burner tubes, down into the grease management system. Not only does this help prevent flare-ups inside your grill, but it also protects the burner tubes from becoming clogged.

Made of either porcelain enamel or stainless steel, Flavorizer bars are durable, long lasting, and easy to care for. Periodically brushing them clean with a Weber stainless-steel grill brush will help keep Flavorizer bars performing at their best. 

GREASE MANAGEMENT
When juices drip off the meat, they funnel down to the Flavorizer bars, and then what doesn't vaporize into wonderful smoke goes down into the grease management system. The grease management system consists of an angled grease tray and catch pan. The grease tray rests beneath the cookbox a safe distance from the burner tubes to prevent the grease from catching fire. Grease is channeled down the grease tray and into the catch pan. Both the grease tray and catch pan are easy to clean. The tray easily slides out of the cabinet for cleaning, and when the catch pan starts to fill, simply remove the disposable drip pan, toss it in the trash, and replace it with an empty pan.

FUEL GAUGE 
A fuel gauge lets you know exactly where you stand on fuel at all times.

SEAR STATION BURNER & SIDE BURNER (SELECT MODELS)
Maximize the heat without minimizing grilling space. This high-powered sear burner is designed to step up the heat on demand for searing. Even more, a flush-mounted side burner lets you multi-task while grilling.

SUMMIT S-670 GAS GRILL
As part of the Summit S series, the S-670 gas grill has a front-mounted lighted control panel with six stainless-steel burners and a Snap-Jet individual burner ignition system. The unit provides stainless-steel cooking grates, stainless-steel Flavorizer bars, a 60,800 BTU-per-hour input, and 769 square inches of total cooking space, which consists of 624 square inches of primary cooking space and a 145-square-inch warming rack. For added versatility, the grill supplies a 12,000-BTU side burner, a 10,600-BTU Sear Station burner, a 6,800 smoker burner, and a 10,600 rear-mounted infrared rotisserie burner for the unit's Tuck-Away rotisserie system, which comes with a flip-up motor and separate spit and fork storage.

Other highlights include an enclosed cart, a stainless-steel shroud with a built-in thermometer, two stainless-steel work areas, two Grill Out lights, six tool hooks, two heavy-duty front-locking casters, and two heavy-duty back swivel casters. Designed for use with natural gas or a 20-pound LP tank (sold separately), the gas grill measures 30 inches long by 74 inches wide by 57 inches high and carries a five-year limited warranty. A 10-foot flexible hose for natural-gas installation comes included.

Note: Images shown above are of the Weber Summit S series and E series in Black; features illustrated vary by model.

 WHAT IS WEBER T.I.P.S.? 
TRADITION
When George Stephen created the first Weber grill, he wanted to be able to bring his family together for a good meal. He insisted on a product that would exceed customers' expectations.

In the years since then, the Weber name has become synonymous with backyard barbecues and the family, friends, and good times that go with them. At Weber, they continue that tradition of excellence in everything they do from the development of new grills and accessories to the services they provide to customer and dealers.

INNOVATION
From the very beginning, Weber revolutionized backyard grilling. Since then, they have continued to develop products that enhance the grilling experience. From the original kettle with heat controlling dampers to electronic temperature controls and Flavorizer bars, Weber continues to be at the forefront of modern grilling, making the backyard a part of your kitchen.

PERFORMANCE
Weber grills have been and will continue to be the true definition of performance in backyard grilling. Whether you're cooking a basic burger or an extensive meal, Weber grills are designed and engineered to give you the best performance every time.

SERVICE
Service is of the utmost importance at Weber. Their Customer and Dealer Service associates work every day to ensure that their customers and dealers have the support they need.

M. Clark5.0 out of 5 stars Like a kid at Christmas!Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2016Style: Natural GasVerified Purchase I had been wanting one of these grills for years, so when my old Genesis Silver finally bit the dust, I was secretly happy. This grill is great and is everything I hoped it would be. It has a massive grilling surface that heats evenly. The sear burner works great and has helped me grill some mean steaks. It is easy to start all the burners and the lighted knobs and grill lights on the handle are a real plus. I've only used the rotisserie once to cook a pork loin, and the pork loin came out great. It is very nice having the rotisserie motor fold down into the side table. There is a lot of storage underneath the grill, especially since mine is natural gas, so no propane bottle. My wife has used the side burner a few times to cook things and said she likes it better than the one on the old Genesis Silver.

However, every grill has both positives and negatives, so I will list a few things that could be better. I wish the infrared burner for the rotisserie was longer. It was long enough for the whole pork loin, but I'm not sure how well it would work for multiple roasts or chickens. It also does take a while to light all six burners and turn them off, but I guess that is what you get with a large grill. I think the smoker box is OK and have used it once, but don't expect it to give more than a little smoke taste to what you are cooking or to smoke that long. If I really want to smoke meat, I have a separate smoker for that.

When this arrived, I felt like a little kid at Christmas time and I keep getting that same feeling every time I use this grill.Read more 23 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse M. Parker5.0 out of 5 stars Great grill - super hot for your steaks, super low for the slow grill technique.Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2018Style: Natural GasVerified Purchase So, I've had this thing about three months. I've had a lot of different gas grills including multiple Weber Genesis, Charbroil, and some Sears. I've always considered them a compromise as I think gas can't offer the same temps as charcoal - especially natural gas which is what I have. And, I agonized over the price of this grill vs the alternatives. As it turns out, it was totally worth it. On the high side, if you light all six burners and let it warm up for a few minutes, the flavorizer bars literally glow red. I can cook a 3/4" steak 'black and blue' in like 8 minutes. We're doing a lot of sous vide lately and with the sear burner on, this thing puts in nice grill lines brilliantly. On the other end, I was also pleasantly surprised, I like to cook chicken legs and thighs low and slow, set the temp low enough that they take like 45 minutes to cook and they come out juicy and nice. Previous grills could barely set low enough for this. I was surprised to discover that this grill, will all burners set on lowest heat is not warm enough to slow cook chicken.

The specs imply that this grill is very heavy and might be difficult to have delivered or difficult to assemble. Ours was delivered by a truck with a lift gate but the guys were in too big a hurry to use the lift gate and then they dropped it! Luckily, it comes well packed and there was no damage. They set it behind the front gate so it was not visible from the street. That evening, my son and I were able to easily carry the main part of it through the house and out to it's proper place. We then carried all of the other pieces out as we assembled it. It took about 45 minutes to assemble, but we're really handy, ymmv. We already had a natural gas connection but the quick connect on it was not the right one. This grill comes with both halves of the quick connect, so a couple wrenches, a few minutes, and a little thread sealer and we were cooking.Read more 6 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse yarnpig5.0 out of 5 stars So glad we selected this Weber grillReviewed in the United States on July 20, 2017Style: Natural GasVerified Purchase A wonderful grill, we are thrilled with it. view larger WEBER SUMMIT S SERIES GAS GRILLS
WELCOME TO TOP OF THE LINE
These outstanding grills are the crown jewels of the Weber family. From exclusive features to the highest level of performance, these babies will make even seasoned grillers blush.

WEBER'S ORIGINAL GAS GRILLING SYSTEM
Notice how sturdy the shroud feels as it opens smoothly on its hinges? See how the burners roar to life on the very first try? Delighted by how simple it is to achieve a mouthwatering meal every time? It's no accident. Weber spends countless hours perfecting the grilling systems on its gas grills, assuring easy assembly, an evenly heated cooking surface, and precision controls so you can tone things down or up to the perfect heat level for direct or indirect cooking.

COOKBOX AND SHROUD
The cookbox houses the components of the cooking system: cooking grates, burner tubes, Favorizer Bars, and the grease management system.

Made of cast aluminum, Weber's gas-grill cookboxes are durable, efficient, require minimal care and maintenance, and can withstand the heat needed to grill at any temperature. In addition, the shape of the cookbox, when combined with the shroud, allows for the proper circulation of heat around food for even cooking whether you're using direct or indirect heat.

COOKING GRATES
Weber gas-grill cooking grates come in three exceptional materials: porcelain-enameled steel, stainless steel, and porcelain-enameled cast-iron. Each type retains heat evenly and sears food beautifully. Porcelain-enameled steel cooking grates are durable and easy to clean. Stainless steel rod cooking grates make lovely sear marks, hold heat very well, and clean up with ease. Porcelain-enameled cast-iron cooking grates combine the ease of porcelain-enameled with the superior heat retention of cast-iron--no need to season and easy to clean.

BURNER TUBES
Weber's burners are made of high-grade stainless steel, which will stand up to the small amounts of water found in liquid propane and natural gas. The burner tubes are made of a singular piece of steel with no welds, making them stronger and more resistant to rust and burn-through. And while they are protected from grease drippings and food by the Flavorizer bars, Weber cart gas grill burner tubes can be cleaned easily by gently brushing with a Weber stainless-steel grill brush.

Controls for each burner give you the ability to grill by the direct or indirect method. Even more, the burners are spaced to provide heat across the entire cooking grate, and the burner valves have infinite control settings, so you can fine-tune the heat levels. 

FLAVORIZER BARS
The innovative Flavorizer bar system, originally created by Weber, is designed perfectly to perform a variety of functions on the Spirit , Summit, and Summit gas grills. Angled just right, the Flavorizer bars catch drippings that smoke and sizzle, adding flavor to your food. Any drippings not vaporized by the Flavorizer bars follow the slope of their unique angle and are funneled away from the burner tubes, down into the grease management system. Not only does this help prevent flare-ups inside your grill, but it also protects the burner tubes from becoming clogged.

Made of either porcelain enamel or stainless steel, Flavorizer bars are durable, long lasting, and easy to care for. Periodically brushing them clean with a Weber stainless-steel grill brush will help keep Flavorizer bars performing at their best. 

GREASE MANAGEMENT
When juices drip off the meat, they funnel down to the Flavorizer bars, and then what doesn't vaporize into wonderful smoke goes down into the grease management system. The grease management system consists of an angled grease tray and catch pan. The grease tray rests beneath the cookbox a safe distance from the burner tubes to prevent the grease from catching fire. Grease is channeled down the grease tray and into the catch pan. Both the grease tray and catch pan are easy to clean. The tray easily slides out of the cabinet for cleaning, and when the catch pan starts to fill, simply remove the disposable drip pan, toss it in the trash, and replace it with an empty pan.

FUEL GAUGE 
A fuel gauge lets you know exactly where you stand on fuel at all times.

SEAR STATION BURNER & SIDE BURNER (SELECT MODELS)
Maximize the heat without minimizing grilling space. This high-powered sear burner is designed to step up the heat on demand for searing. Even more, a flush-mounted side burner lets you multi-task while grilling.

SUMMIT S-670 GAS GRILL
As part of the Summit S series, the S-670 gas grill has a front-mounted lighted control panel with six stainless-steel burners and a Snap-Jet individual burner ignition system. The unit provides stainless-steel cooking grates, stainless-steel Flavorizer bars, a 60,800 BTU-per-hour input, and 769 square inches of total cooking space, which consists of 624 square inches of primary cooking space and a 145-square-inch warming rack. For added versatility, the grill supplies a 12,000-BTU side burner, a 10,600-BTU Sear Station burner, a 6,800 smoker burner, and a 10,600 rear-mounted infrared rotisserie burner for the unit's Tuck-Away rotisserie system, which comes with a flip-up motor and separate spit and fork storage.

Other highlights include an enclosed cart, a stainless-steel shroud with a built-in thermometer, two stainless-steel work areas, two Grill Out lights, six tool hooks, two heavy-duty front-locking casters, and two heavy-duty back swivel casters. Designed for use with natural gas or a 20-pound LP tank (sold separately), the gas grill measures 30 inches long by 74 inches wide by 57 inches high and carries a five-year limited warranty. A 10-foot flexible hose for natural-gas installation comes included.

Note: Images shown above are of the Weber Summit S series and E series in Black; features illustrated vary by model.

 WHAT IS WEBER T.I.P.S.? 
TRADITION
When George Stephen created the first Weber grill, he wanted to be able to bring his family together for a good meal. He insisted on a product that would exceed customers' expectations.

In the years since then, the Weber name has become synonymous with backyard barbecues and the family, friends, and good times that go with them. At Weber, they continue that tradition of excellence in everything they do from the development of new grills and accessories to the services they provide to customer and dealers.

INNOVATION
From the very beginning, Weber revolutionized backyard grilling. Since then, they have continued to develop products that enhance the grilling experience. From the original kettle with heat controlling dampers to electronic temperature controls and Flavorizer bars, Weber continues to be at the forefront of modern grilling, making the backyard a part of your kitchen.

PERFORMANCE
Weber grills have been and will continue to be the true definition of performance in backyard grilling. Whether you're cooking a basic burger or an extensive meal, Weber grills are designed and engineered to give you the best performance every time.

SERVICE
Service is of the utmost importance at Weber. Their Customer and Dealer Service associates work every day to ensure that their customers and dealers have the support they need.
